content: The syntax linter PRed at #15794 checks whether a file starts with a doc-module string right after the imports.
It flagged exactly the files that are "import only" files: should such files be automatically exempt from having a doc-module string?
I suspect that the python linter that checks this uses a similar heuristic, since that linter does not seem to have logged exceptions.
Yes, iirc import-only files are officially exempted from the module-doc requirement
Ok, great, I already modified the linter to ignore import-only files.
It looks like test files are also exempt from linting.
